Menu.Container.name: sizing
Menu.Container.description: Changes how big the Menu components will be rendered.

Menu.Anchor.name: active
Menu.Anchor.description: Renders the Menu.Anchor with aria-pressed attribute, and styles the Menu.Anchor as if it where being clicked.

Menu.Anchor.name: disabled
Menu.Anchor.description: Renders the Menu.Anchor with aria-disabled attributes, and styles the Menu.Anchor partially transparent.

Menu.Anchor.name: href
Menu.Anchor.description: Renders the Menu.Anchor as a <a role="button"> and links to the specified href property.

Menu.Anchor.name: download
Menu.Anchor.description: If linking to a downloadable file, this property will be used as the suggested file name.

Menu.Anchor.name: rel
Menu.Anchor.description: Sets how the Menu.Anchor relates to the current page, see MDN for more information.

Menu.Anchor.name: target
Menu.Anchor.description: Sets the target of the Menu.Anchor being navigated, see MDN for more information.

Menu.Button.name: active
Menu.Button.description: Renders the Menu.Button with aria-pressed attribute, and styles the Menu.Button as if it where being clicked.

Menu.Button.name: disabled
Menu.Button.description: Renders the Menu.Button with disabled attributes, and styles the Menu.Button partially transparent.

Menu.Label.name: active
Menu.Label.description: Renders the Menu.Label with aria-pressed attribute, and styles the Menu.Label as if it where being clicked.

Menu.Label.name: disabled
Menu.Label.description: Renders the Menu.Label with disabled attributes, and styles the Menu.Label partially transparent.

Menu.Label.name: for
Menu.Label.description: Sets the ID used by the <label> to target it's child form Component.

data.render:
Menu

Menu renders a nestable list of actionable buttons and links. Typically used in context menus or used as the main content body of Aside.

Imports

<script>
    import {Menu} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const {
        Container,
        Anchor,
        Button,
        Divider,
        Heading,
        Item,
        Label,
        SubMenu,
    } = Menu;
</script>

Orientation

NOTE: By passing an array, you can set responsive values. e.g. orientation={["tablet:horizontal", "mobile:horizontal"]}

IMPORTANT: You should never use sub menus whenever using horizontal Menu.Container Components.

You can alter the orientation of how the Menu.Container lays out the children.

Sub Menus

You can nest more menus via <Menu.SubMenu> Component and using <svelte:fragment slot="sub-menu"> in <Menu.Divider> or <Menu.Heading> Components.

Text Divider

In place of <Menu.Heading> you can also use <Menu.Divider> with text content.

Palette

You can change the color palette of the Menu.Anchor / Menu.Button / Menu.Label via the palette property.
